DataElement.preferredName: Patient Radiation Therapy Prior Registration Exclusion Criteria Ind-3b
DataElement.preferredDefinition: an indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable related to the administration of treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation prior to registration or enrollment on a clinical trial as a medical and/or social characteristic that prevents a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Radiation Therapy Prior Registration Exclusion Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the administration of treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation prior to registration or enrollment on a clinical trial as a medical and/or social characteristic that prevents a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Prior Registration Exclusion Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:Earlier in time or order.:Registration; the act of enrolling.:Exclusion; the act of restricting entrance or barring from participation.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.
Medical and/or social characteristics that prevent a subject from being allowed to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ReferenceDocuments.name: Prior radiation completed >=4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior radiation completed >=4 weeks prior to study enrollment, and associated toxicities resolved to eligibility levels.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Radiation therapy <=3 weeks prior to study entry

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Any radiation therapy <=4 weeks prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Radiation therapy <=4 weeks prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: At least 2 weeks from completion of prior radiation therapy with full recovery from toxicities

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has had radiation therapy within 2 weeks of beginning of study treatment

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN
ReferenceDocuments.description: At least 2 weeks from completion of prior radiation therapy with no residual radiation toxicities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has last local site RT been completed at least 14 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have full recovery of radiation related side effects prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has had radiation therapy within 2 weeks of beginning study retreatment

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 01
ReferenceDocuments.description: If Yes, Did patient enroll after completion of external beam radiotherapy and after completion of the standard Post-Consolidation disease assessment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has last local site RT been completed at least 14 days prior to Step 2 registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF text 02
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient only undergoing radiation therapy?
